item.title: Unmasking the true villain
item.description:
Dear Amy,

How is this life like Scooby-Doo?

Every Scooby-Doo episode I can remember ends in the same way. The mystery villain is finally unmasked by the gang and is seen to be a familiar character, who then says, â€œAnd I would have gotten away with it too, if it weren’t for you meddling kids!â€

Paul tells a similar tale in his letter to the Ephesians.

For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.

â€• Ephesians 6:12

What an important lesson there is here. How often life can seem so adversarial, with obstacles being put in our way by people who are frankly, just so annoying! Aargh!

If instead we can step back and regain perspective, discerning who is the real enemy and recognising that we are in the middle of a spiritual battle in the heavenly realms, the Holy Spirit will be able to equip us with everything we need to face this. That is the only way to prevail in the spiritual battle.

In the face of hostility, for example, may we respond with gentleness and kindness towards the one who is not our enemy. Hearts are healed like this, the Lord is glorified and the devil thwarted.

Is this asking too much though? How could we possibly live like this? Paul tells us how.

Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power. Put on the full armour of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil’s schemes.

â€• Ephesians 6:10-11

There’s clearly a bit to be said about the armour of God. For now, though, be a meddling kid and unmask the true villain!

Your struggle is not against flesh and blood, Amy, so put on the full armour of God, so that when the day of evil comes, you may be able to stand your ground, and after you have done everything, to stand. ğŸ™

item.title: Kindness
item.description:
Dear Amy,

What is one of the most important considerations when engaging with someone in a difficult conversation? When everything within you wants to make your point, to justify yourself with great vigour? When you have waited for so long and the time is now?

The fruit of the Spirit is … kindness

â€• Galatians 5:22

How easy this is to overlook. Could I be overstating its importance though? I think not. Consider this.

â€œI am the LORD, who exercises kindness, justice and righteousness on earth, for in these I delight,â€ declares the LORD.

â€• Jeremiah 9:24

Kindness is remarkably prominent don’t you think? And the Lord delights in it! And what of this, which characterizes Jesus as the embodiment of kindness and love?

When the kindness and love of God our Saviour appeared, he saved us …

â€• Titus 3:4-5

Consider those who hurt us, and don’t even know they have. What better way is there to bless than with kindness? There’s real power in this, power to heal, and power to save. It is a work of the Holy Spirit that we can live like this, in giving rather than receiving.

As Godâ€™s chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with … kindness
